action->Recognize Ally.description: Eine Drachensäule kann durch die leeren Augen des Drachenkopfes blicken und Angehörige der Ascheklauen und ihre Verbündeten erkennen. Ein als Ascheklaue verkleideter SC kann eine Drachensäule mittels eines Fertigkeitswurfes für Täuschung zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Verkleiden} täuschen. Eine Drachensäule nutzt stets ihren Modifikator für Wahrnehmung für Initiativewürfe.

action->Dragon Pillar Glance.name: Drachensäulenblick
action->Dragon Pillar Glance.description:
Auslöser Die Drachensäule sieht innerhalb von 120 Fuß/36 m Entfernung eine Kreatur, die sie nicht als Ascheklaue oder Verbündeten des Kultes erkennt.

Effekt Die Drachensäule feuert einen Augenstrahl auf die auslösende Kreatur ab und würfelt ihre Initiative.

action->Black Eye Beam.name: Schwarzer Augenstrahl
action->Black Eye Beam.description:
@Check[type:fortitude|dc:24|traits:hazard,trap]{ZÄH}

Kritischer Erfolg Das Ziel ist nicht betroffen.

Erfolg Das Ziel erhält für 1 Runde den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blind}.

Fehlschlag Das Ziel erhält für 1 Stunde den Zustand Blind.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Das Ziel erhält für 24 Stunden den Zustand Blind.

strike-ranged->Eye Beam.name: Augenstrahl
strike-ranged->Eye Beam.description: Effekt Das Ziel unterliegt einem Effekt nach der Farbe der Säule (siehe unten). Bei einem Kritischen Treffer geht das Ergebnis des Rettungswurfes um 1 Schritt schlechter aus.

action->Blue Eye Beam.name: Blauer Augenstrahl
action->Blue Eye Beam.description:
@Check[type:fortitude|dc:24|traits:trap,hazard]

Kritischer Erfolg Das Ziel ist nicht betroffen.

Erfolg Das Ziel erhält für 1 Runde den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Versteinert}.

Fehlschlag Das Ziel erhält für 1 Stunde den Zustand Versteinert.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Das Ziel erhält dauerhaft den Zustand Versteinert.

action->Indigo Eye Beam.name: Indigofarbener Augenstrahl
action->Indigo Eye Beam.description:
@Check[type:will|dc:24|traits:trap,hazard].

Kritischer Erfolg Das Ziel ist nicht betroffen.

Erfolg Das Ziel erhält für 1 Runde den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Verlangsamt 1}.

Fehlschlag Das Ziel erhält für 1 Runde den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Verwirrt}.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Das Ziel fällt unter die Kontrolle der Drachensäule, erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Gesteuert} und entfernt sich nicht weiter als 60 Fuß/18 m von ihr. Es verteidigt sie gegen alle, die nicht dem Kult angehören. Solange das Ziel unter Kontrolle steht, behandelt die Säule es als Verbündeten der Ascheklauen.

Die Drachensäule kann bis zu 3 Ziele zugleich kontrollieren; alle weiteren Ziele, welche einen Kritischen Fehlschlag bei diesem Rettungswurf erzielen, erhalten stattdessen für [[/br 1d4+1 #Verwirrte Runden]]{1W4+1 Runden} den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Verwirrt}. Eine gesteuerte Kreatur kann alle 24 Stunden einen neuen Willenswurf ablegen, um der Kontrolle zu entkommen, allerdings greift die Drachensäule dann automatisch mit einem neuen Augenstrahl an, um die Kontrolle zurückzuerlangen. Die Kontrolle endet mit der Zerstörung der Säule.

action->Violet Eye Beam.name: Violetter Augenstrahl
action->Violet Eye Beam.description:
@Check[type:will|dc:24|traits:trap,hazard].

Kritischer Erfolg Das Ziel ist nicht betroffen.

Erfolg Das Ziel erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 1}.

Fehlschlag Das Ziel erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 3}.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Das Ziel erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 7}.

Dragonscarred Dead.name: Untoter Drachentöter
Dragonscarred Dead.publicNotes:
{"ActorName":"Untoter Drachentöter","ActorDescription":"

Nicht alle aufstrebenden Drachentöter, die einen heroischen Tod erleiden, ruhen in friedvoll in den Annalen der Legenden. Es kommt vor, dass ein drakonischer Nekromant so beeindruckt von seinem besiegten Gegner ist, dass der Drache den toten Krieger mit einem Ritual erweckt, um ihn zu seinem untoten Diener zu machen. Diese untoten Wächter sind von einem kleinen Teil der Macht des Drachen erfüllt, der sie erschlug und fokussieren die gleiche Art von Energie wie dem Odem ihres Meisters.

Untote Drachentöter sind Grabesrittern und Skelettstreitern insoweit ähnlich, als sie nicht einfach animierte Schergen sind, die nur geistlos Befehlen folgen, sondern machtvolle Wächter, die über den gleichen Antrieb verfügen wie einst im Leben. Obwohl Untote Drachentöter meist magisch gezwungen werden, den Befehlen ihrer Schöpfer zu folgen, können sich einige dieser Untoten von dieser Kontrolle befreien und verfolgen dann ihre eigenen finsteren Ziele. Dazu kann es gehören, Verbündete zu sammeln um ihren drakonischen Schöpfer erneut herauszufordern und ihre gefährliche Mission zu beenden, die sie zu Lebzeiten begonnen hatten

","AdditionalInfo":{"rule0":{"Andere Varianten":"

Für Untote Drachentöter, die von nicht Feuerdrachen erschaffen wurden, ersetze Feuer bei den Eigenschaften, Immunitäten und dem Schaden der Odemversehrten Waffe durch die Energieart, die der Odemwaffe des erschaffenden Drachen entspricht. Die Regeneration des Untoten Drachentöters wird wie folgt deaktiviert: Elektrizität (deaktiviert von Säure), Gift (Feuer oder Kälte), Kälte (Feuer), Säure (Elektrizität).

"}}}
Dragonscarred Dead.saveDetails: Zustandsbonus +1 auf alle RW gg. Magie

action->Guardian Sense.name: Wächtersinn
action->Guardian Sense.description: Der Untote Drachentöter bemerkt augenblicklich jeden Eindringling im Unterschlupf seines drakonischen Schöpfers. Er kennt jedoch nicht die genaue Position des Eindringlings, ist sich aber der Präsenz des Eindringlings solange bewusst, bis dieser entweder zerstört wird oder den Ort verlässt.

action->Breath-Seared Sword.name: Odemversehrte Waffe
action->Breath-Seared Sword.description: Die Waffe eines Untoten Drachentöters ist magisch von der Odemwaffen eines Drachen versehrt. Wird sie von dem Untoten Drachentöters geführt, der sie zu seinen Lebzeiten besaß, richtet die Waffe zusätzlich @Damage[2d6[void],3d6[fire]]{2W6 Punkte Leerenschaden und 3W6 Punkte Feuerschaden} an. In den Händen jeder anderen Kreatur ist sie nur eine Beschädigte Waffe.

action->Glare of Rage.name: Zornesblick
action->Glare of Rage.description:
Der Untote Drachentöter fokussiert seine grenzenlose Frustration in einem Blick, der eine Kreatur innerhalb von 30 Fuß/9 m zum Ziel hat. Die Kreatur muss einen @Check[type:will|dc:30]{Willenswurf} ablegen.

Kritischer Erfolg Die Kreatur ist nicht betroffen.

Erfolg Die Kreatur erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 1}.

Fehlschlag Die Kreatur erhält 1 Runde lang den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt}.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Die Kreatur erhält [[/br 1d4 #Runden]]{1W4 Runden} lang die Zustände Betäubt und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Erschöpft}.

Dragonshard Guardian.name: Sphärensplitterwächter
Dragonshard Guardian.publicNotes:
{"ActorName":"Sphärensplitterwächter","ActorDescription":"

Dieses Konstrukt, geschaffen von Mengkare und angetrieben durch einen Splitter der @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.L8OButuVM3PFxgrZ]{Sphäre der Golddrachenherrschaft}, besteht aus Kristall in einem goldenen Drahtgeflecht.

","AdditionalInfo":{"lore0":{"Andere Wächter":"

Möglicherweise existieren ähnliche Wächter aus den Überresten anderer Artefakt. Diese Wächter sollten in ihrem Aussehen, besonderen Fähigkeiten und Zweck einzigartig sein. Du kannst aber den hier beschriebenen Wächter als Inspiration nutzen, um deine eigenen zu erschaffen.

"}}}

action->Breath Weapon.name: Odemwaffe
action->Breath Weapon.description:
Das Konstrukt kann eine von zwei Odemwaffen einsetzen. Danach kann es seine Odemwaffe [[/br 1d4 #Runden]]{1W4 Runden} lang nicht erneut benutzen.

  • Flamme (Arkan, Feuer, Hervorrufung) Ein Feuerstoß verursacht bei allen Kreaturen in einem @Template[type:cone|distance:60]{Kegel von 60 Fuß/18 m} @Damage[15d10[fire]]{15W10 Feuerschaden} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:45|basic:true]). Dieser Feuerschaden beschädigt keine Objekte oder Konstrukte.
  • Schwächegas (Arkan, Nekromantie) Eine Wolke aus golden funkelndem Gas zwingt jede Kreatur in einem @Template[type:cone|distance:60]{Kegel von 60 Fuß/18 m} einen @Check[type:fortitude|dc:45]{Zähigkeitswurf} abzulegen; der Effekt hält 1 Minute lang an.
    Kritischer Erfolg Die Kreatur ist nicht betroffen.
    Erfolg Die Kreatur erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 2}.
    Fehlschlag Die Kreatur erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 5}.
    Kritischer Fehlschlag Die Kreatur erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 8}.

action->Reverberating Revenge.name: Widerhallende Rache
action->Reverberating Revenge.description:
Auslöser Der Sphärensplitterwächter erleidet Elektrizitäts-, Feuer-, Kälte- oder Schallschaden durch eine Quelle, die kein Sphärensplitterwächter ist

Effekt Der Körper des Sphärensplitterwächters absorbiert die gesamte Energie und verhindert, dass das Konstrukt Schaden erleidet. Sein Körper wird in Schwingung versetzt und transformiert die absorbierte Energie, bevor er sie in einer @Template[type:burst|distance:60]{Explosion von 60 Fuß/18 m} nach außen projiziert. Jede Kreatur innerhalb der Explosion nimmt Feuerschaden in Höhe des Schadens des auslösenden Angriffs, inklusive des Schadens, dem das Konstrukt aufgrund von Resistenzen widerstanden hat und jedem zusätzlichen Schaden aufgrund von Schwächen (@Check[type:reflex|dc:45|basic:true]{einfacher Reflexwurf}). Dieser Feuerschaden beschädigt keine Objekte oder Konstrukte.

Dragonstorm.name: Drachensturm
Dragonstorm.description: Ein gewaltiger Sturm bildet sich am Himmel über Bruchhügel und der Zitadelle Altaerein. Während besondere Ereignisse während der drei Wellen von Dahaks Rache eintreten, sorgt der Drachensturm für lokal begrenztes Chaos.
Dragonstorm.disable: Der Drachensturm kann nicht entschärft oder ausgeschaltet werden – man muss ihn ertragen. Er endet erst, wenn der Angriff auf Bruchhügel und die Zitadelle vorbei ist.

action->Localized Dragonstorm.name: Lokalisierter Drachensturm
action->Localized Dragonstorm.description:
Auslöser Eine neue Welle beginnt

Effekt Würfle mit [[/br 1d10]]{1W10}, um zu bestimmen, welcher der möglichen Effekte sich manifestiert. Dahaks Wille bestimmt, wo sich die Effekte manifestieren, d.h. sie manifestieren sich jeweils dort, wo sie den SC die meisten Probleme bereiten.

action->1-2 Acid Rain.name: 1-2: Säureregen
action->1-2 Acid Rain.description: Stark säurehaltiger Niederschlag durchnässt Kreaturen in einem @Template[type:burst|distance:20]{Explosionsradius von 20 Fuß/6 m}. Kreaturen im Wirkungsbereich erleiden @Damage[6d10[acid]]{6W10 Punkte Säureschaden} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true]{einfacher Reflexwurf}; bei einem Kritischen Fehlschlag erleidet eine Kreatur zudem @Damage[5[persistent,acid]]{5 Punkte anhaltenden Säureschaden}).

action->3-4 Freezing Wind.name: 3-4: Eisiger Wind
action->3-4 Freezing Wind.description: Eisige Winde und Hagel greifen alle Kreaturen in einem @Template[type:burst|distance:20]{Explosionsradius von 20 Fuß/6 m} an. Kreaturen im Wirkungsbereich erleiden @Damage[3d10[cold],3d10[bludgeoning]]{3W10 Punkte Kälte- und 3W10 Punkte Wuchtschaden} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true]; bei einem Kritischen Fehlschlag erhält eine Kreatur zudem für 1 Runde den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Verlangsamt 1}).

action->5-6 Bolts of Lightning.name: 5-6: Blitze
action->5-6 Bolts of Lightning.description: Blitze fahren auf alle Kreaturen in einem @Template[type:burst|distance:20]{Explosionsradius von 20 Fuß/6 m} nieder. Kreaturen im Wirkungsbereich erleiden @Damage[6d10[electricity]]{6W10 Punkte Elektrizitätsschaden} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true]{einfacher Reflexwurf}; bei einem Kritischen Fehlschlag erhält eine Kreatur zudem für 1 Runde die Zustände @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blind} und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Taub}).

action->7-8 Flaming Vortex.name: 7-8: Flammenwirbel
action->7-8 Flaming Vortex.description: Feuerstrahlen fahren auf alle Kreaturen innerhalb eines @Template[type:burst|distance:20]{Explosionsradius von 20 Fuß/6 m} herab. Kreaturen im Wirkungsbereich erleiden @Damage[6d10[fire]]{6W10 Punkte Feuerschaden} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true]{einfacher Reflexwurf}; bei einem Kritischen Fehlschlag erleidet eine Kreatur zudem [[/r 5[persistent,fire]]]{5 Punkte anhaltenden Feuerschaden}).

action->9-10 Poison Miasma.name: 9-10: Giftnebel
action->9-10 Poison Miasma.description: Giftiger Nebel senkt sich herab und bedeckt einen @Template[type:burst|distance:20]{Explosionsradius von 20 Fuß/6 m} für 1 Runde. Kreaturen innerhalb des Nebels erhalten den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Verborgen}, während Kreaturen außerhalb des Nebels gegenüber denen im Nebel den Zustand Verborgen erlangen. Kreaturen innerhalb des Nebels erleiden @Damage[6d10[poison]]{6W10 Punkte Giftschaden} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:42|basic:true]{einfacher ZÄH}; bei einem Kritischen Fehlschlag erleidet eine Kreatur den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 2}.

action->Dragonstorm Blade.name: Drachensturmklinge
action->Dragonstorm Blade.description: Der Drachensturm-Feuerriese ballt die Faust gen Himmel und leitet Drachensturmenergie in die Klinge in der anderen Hand. Der Riese führt einen Zweihänderangriff mit einem Situationsmalus von -2 gegen jede Kreatur innerhalb seines Angriffsradius. Er legt nur einen Angriffswurf ab und vergleicht das Ergebnis mit der RK jeder Kreatur. Dieser Angriff verursacht zusätzlich jeweils @Damage[1d8[electricity],1d8[fire],1d8[poison],1d8[cold],1d8[acid]]{1W8 Punkte Elektrizitäts-, Feuer-, Gift-, Kälte- und Säureschaden} und zählt als zwei Angriffe hinsichtlich des Malus für Mehrfachangriffe des Riesen.

Duergar Slave Lord.name: Duergarsklavenmeister
Duergar Slave Lord.saveDetails: Statusbonus +2 auf alle RW gg. Magie

action->Improved Evasion.name: Verbessertes Entrinnen
action->Improved Evasion.description: Erfolgreiche Reflexwürfe des Sklavenmeisters zählen als Kritische Erfolge. Seine Kritischen Fehlschläge zählen dagegen als normale Fehlschläge. Misslingt dem Sklavenmeister ein Reflexwurf gegen einen Schadenseffekt, so erleidet er nur halben Schaden

action->Hunt Prey.name: Jagdbeute
action->Hunt Prey.description: Der Sklavenmeister wählt eine Kreatur, die er sehen oder hören kann oder deren Spuren er folgt, zu seiner Beute. Er erhält einen Situationsbonus von +2 auf Wahrnehmungswürfe, wenn er seine Beute @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Sucht} und auf Fertigkeitswürfe für Überlebenskunst zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Spuren der Beute lesen}. Er ignoriert zudem den Entfernungsmalus auf Fernkampfangriffe gegen die Beute, sofern diese nicht weiter als die zweite Entfernungseinheit entfernt ist. Trifft der Sklavenmeister seine Jagdbeute erstmals in einer Runde, fügt er ihr zusätzliche [[/r 2d8[precision]]]{2W8 Punkte Präzisionsschaden} zu. Ein Sklavenmeister kann stets nur über eine ausgewählte Jagdbeute verfügen.

action->Hunter's Flurry.name: Jägervorteil
action->Hunter's Flurry.description:
Häufigkeit Einmal pro Runde

Effekt Der Sklavenmeister führt zwei Angriffe mit dem Bogen oder zwei Nahkampfangriffe mit unterschiedlichen Waffen aus. Ziel muss jeweils seine Jagdbeute sein. Trifft er mit beiden Angriffen, so addiere den Schaden hinsichtlich Resistenzen und Schwächen.

Echoes of Betrayal.name: Echos des Verrats
Echoes of Betrayal.description: Bösartige Geister unter der Führung der geisterhaften Ludika erheben sich und stürzen sich mit blanken Fäusten auf Eindringlinge. Diese Geister wollen lebende Kreaturen überwältigen und zwingen, Teil der Prügelei zu werden.
Echoes of Betrayal.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:35|name:Exorcise|traits:haunt,complex] (Meister), drei Mal, um die Geister zu exorzieren, oder @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:39|name:Talk Down|traits:haunt,complex] (Experte), drei Mal, um ihnen die Schlägerei auszureden.
Echoes of Betrayal.reset: Nach 24 Stunden kehrt die Spukerscheinung zurück. Die Geister können nur dann dauerhaft zur Ruhe gelegt werden, wenn ein rechtmäßig ernannter Richter aus Saggorak (oder Kovlar) das Gefängnis betritt, durch die Spukerscheinung Schaden erleidet und dies überlebt.
Echoes of Betrayal.routine: (1 Aktion) Mit 1 Aktion entfesselt der Spuk einen Hagel geisterhafter Fäuste, die aus den Wänden, dem Boden und der Decke herausprügeln. Die Spukerscheinung führt einen Geisterfaustangriff gegen jede Kreatur in Bereich H10 aus.
Echoes of Betrayal.stealth: (Meister), um das leise Murmeln der zornigen Geister zu hören

action->Confuse.name: Verwirren
action->Confuse.description:
Auslöser Wenigstens drei Kreaturen betreten Bereich H10.

Effekt Die Spukerscheinung ergreift die Kontrolle über alle Kreaturen im Gefängnis und betrifft sie mit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LiGbewa9pO0yjbsY]{Verwirrung} (8. Grad, @Check[type:will|dc:37]).

strike-melee->Spectral Fist.name: Geisterfaust
strike-melee->Spectral Fist.description: Bei einem Treffer muss die Kreatur einen neuen @Check[type:will|dc:37|name:Spectral Fist Confusion]{Willenswurf} gegen @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LiGbewa9pO0yjbsY]{Verwirrung} ablegen, sofern sie noch nicht den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Verwirrt} besitzt.

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
spell->Dancing Lights.description: Du erschaffst eine Lichtkugel, die in einem Umkreis von 20 Fuß/6 m helles Licht (und in den nächsten 20 Fuß/6 m Dämmerlicht) in einer Farbe deiner Wahl ausstrahlt. Wenn du das Licht im selben Raum wie eine willige Kreatur erschaffst, kannst du das Licht an die Kreatur binden, so dass es in der Nähe der Kreatur schwebt, wenn sie sich bewegt. Du kannst den Zauber Aufrechterhalten, um das Licht bis zu 60 Fuß/18 m weit zu bewegen; du kannst es als Teil dieser Bewegung an eine Kreatur anheften oder von ihr lösen.

action->Double Slice.name: Doppelschnitt
action->Double Slice.description: Die Ekujae-Wache führt zwei Angriffe gegen dasselbe Ziel mit jeweils einem Dolch aus. Die Wache addiert den Schaden bei erfolgreichen Angriffen, addiert den Präzisionsschaden, Resistenz und Schwächen aber nur einmal. Beide Angriffe zählen gegen seinen Malus für Mehrfachangriffe, der Malus steigt aber erst nach dem zweiten Angriff.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
Die Ekujae-Wache fügen Kreaturen, die Auf dem Falschen Fuß sind, zusätzlich [[/r 1d6[precision]]]{1W6 Präzisionsschaden} zu.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

action->Woodland Stride.name: Unterholz durchqueren
action->Woodland Stride.description: Die Ekujae-Wachen ignorieren Schwieriges Gelände, sofern es aus Pflanzenwuchs resultiert.

spell->Ray of Enfeeblement.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]

equipment->Flawed Orb of Gold Dragonkind.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.9Ptn7yy2QeM8taU8]

Each of the legendary Orbs of Dragonkind contains the essence and personality of a powerful dragon. The Orb of Gold Dragonkind was the most powerful of them all, until it was shattered by Mengkare's draconic breath. Reconstructed at great expense by enslaved spellcasters toiling under the Scarlet Triad's watch, the Flawed Orb of Gold Dragonkind is a shadow of its prior self, yet it remains a potent weapon against dragons of all types.

While carried, the Flawed Orb of Gold Dragonkind grants its owner resistance 30 to the Breath Weapons of gold dragons. The owner also can sense if there are any dragons within 10f gold dragons. The owner also can sense if there are any dragons within 10 miles, or any gold dragons within 100 miles. When within 1 mile of a dragon, they can determine the direction to the dragon and the dragon's age category (such as young, ancient, or wyrm).

Activate 2 envision, Interact

Frequency Three times per day

Effect You attempt to overwhelm a dragon's mind-while you cannot control the dragon, you can render it immobile for a short time. Choose a dragon within 60 feet; the dragon can attempt to resist the orb with a @Check[type:will|dc:30] saving throw (or higher with orb shards). Gold dragons take a -4 circumstance penalty to this saving throw. Any stun from this activation ends if the dragon is attacked or otherwise subject to a hostile act other than that of the orb.

Critical Success The dragon is unaffected.

Success The dragon is stunned 3.

Failure The dragon is stunned for as long as the orb's wielder Sustains the Activation.

Critical Failure As failure, but hostile actions don't end the dragon's stun.

Destruction The Flawed Orb of Gold Dragonkind is resilient, but its imperfect nature leaves it vulnerable. It can be damaged or even destroyed by mundane attacks (Hardness 40, HP 200, BT 100). It has weakness 30 to the Breath Weapons and Strikes of gold dragons.

equipment->Winged Boots.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.aKoMqPDmVzPI7Q20]
Winged Boots
equipment->Winged Boots.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.aKoMqPDmVzPI7Q20]

Made from soft leather, with delicate white wings attached to the heel, these boots are ensorcelled with powerful air magic.

Whenever you fall while wearing these boots, the boots automatically cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TTwOKGqmZeKSyNMH]{Gentle Landing} on you. This benefit can't trigger again for 10 minutes.

Activate 2 command, Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You speak a command word and click the boots' heels together to cause the wings to animate and flap rapidly, granting you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.1S51uIRb9bnZtpFU]{Effect: Winged Boots}

action->Contingency.name: Contingency
action->Contingency.description:
Trigger Emaliza is attacked

Effect A 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate} spell is cast on Emaliza; she uses this to escape an attack that she fears would incapacitate or kill her.

action->Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
action->Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Emaliza hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect Emaliza can cast one prepared spell she has already cast today without spending a spell slot.

action->Warded Casting.name: Warded Casting
action->Warded Casting.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger Emaliza Casts a Spell

Effect Emaliza's magic creates a small defensive aura around her. She gains 20 temporary Hit Points and resistance 20 to either acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage. The defensive aura remains until the beginning of her next turn.

Emperor Bird.name: Emperor Bird
Emperor Bird.publicNotes:
The emperor bird is native to the jungles of the Mwangi Expanse and known for its brilliant plumage and innate magic. While it usually feeds on lizards, big insects, and other small creatures, the emperor bird is highly territorial and not afraid to attack larger prey. Its beak, resembling that of the much smaller peafowl, is exceptionally sharp, but its deadliest weapon is its tail-the long, whiplike blades of bone hidden among its tail feathers are a nasty surprise for any predator trying to sneak up on the bird.

The emperor bird was given its current name 2,000 years ago when Taldor's Sixth Army of Exploration ventured into the Mwangi Expanse. When the legion spotted this 6-foot-long bird with its spectacular multicolored feathers trailing from its tail, wings, and crest, the soldiers thought the bird regal enough to suit their emperor, disregarding the name the Mwangi had given to the bird generations before, bebaki.

Keeping an emperor bird was, for many years, a sign of prestige among the nobility of Taldor. That was long ago, however, and emperor birds eventually fell out of fashion. Inevitably their former owners forgot about their colorful pets, and hundreds of neglected emperor birds were released back into the wild by weary servants. While many such freed birds perished quickly in the unfamiliar woodlands of Avistan, some managed to hold out, and emperor birds can still be encountered in the Verduran Forest.

The emperor bird uses its brilliant, iridescent plumage for mating displays as well as for intimidating rival suitors and potential predators. Not only are the feathers beautiful, but they are actually magical-a fact that has piqued the interest of alchemists and wizards alike, many of whom have spent decades capturing and breeding emperor birds in the hope of unlocking their arcane secrets. Mages stationed in the Mwangi Expanse will pay a pretty penny for intact feathers from these majestic creatures-or better yet, live specimens.

action->Dazzling Display.name: Dazzling Display
action->Dazzling Display.description:
The emperor bird flaps its mesmerizing wings. Each creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:15]{15 feet} that can see the emperor bird must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is dazzled for [[/br 1d4 #Dazzled Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/br 1d4 #Confused Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
action->Tail Lash.description: The emperor bird makes tail Strikes against two different creatures within reach. The emperor bird's multiple attack penalty does not increase until it has finished both attacks.

Endless Elven Aging.name: Endless Elven Aging
Endless Elven Aging.description: A haunted mural fascinates characters and swiftly drains their vitality.
Endless Elven Aging.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:38|name:Calm the Restless Energies|traits:haunt,magical] (master) or @Check[type:religion|dc:38|name:Calm the Restless Energies|traits:haunt,magical] (master) to calm the restless energies and suppress the haunt for 1 hour; a critical success deactivates the haunt permanently.
Endless Elven Aging.hpDetails: per square (6 squares must be destroyed to disable the haunt)
Endless Elven Aging.reset: The haunt continues its routine until there are no targets within 30 feet of the room. It then resets over the course of 1 minute and is able to activate again.
Endless Elven Aging.routine: (2 actions) The haunt lures creatures into area A2 using Captivate. Any actions it hasn't used to Captivate are used to drain a living creature in the room with Live a Thousand Lives.

action->Lifelike Scintillation.name: Lifelike Scintillation
action->Lifelike Scintillation.description:
Trigger A living creature examines the mural or enters the room

Effect The haunt activates and rolls initiative.

action->Captivate.name: Captivate
action->Captivate.description:
The faintly moving images compel one creature within 30 feet of the room to move into the room. The creature attempts a @Check[type:will|dc:38|traits:charm] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target must spend all its actions on its next turn moving into the room, and is then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, and the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

action->Live a Thousand Lives.name: Live a Thousand Lives
action->Live a Thousand Lives.description:
The haunt causes a living creature in the room to experience a full elven life, weathering every wound, misfortune, loss, and consequence of aging centuries in a matter of seconds. The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or its drained value increases by 1, to a maximum of drained 3), and it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (or its doomed value increases by 1).

action->Lazurite-Infused Flesh.name: Lazurite-Infused Flesh
action->Lazurite-Infused Flesh.description: Falrok's flesh is infused with lazurite, and he gains the benefits undead creatures gain from this mineral at all times. When in an area infused with lazurite, such as the Sanctum of the Starved, these benefits increase to a +3 circumstance bonus to saving throws against vitality effects. This infusion also grants Falrok his resistance to vitality damage.

action->Opportune Backstab.name: Opportune Backstab
action->Opportune Backstab.description:
Trigger A creature within Falrok's melee reach is hit by a melee attack from one of his allies.

Effect When Falrok's enemy is hit by one of his allies, he capitalizes upon the distraction, making a Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Stench.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.SEzkqVJxr2eJDsuJ]
Stench
action->Stench.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.SEzkqVJxr2eJDsuJ]

10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

action->Scoundrel.name: Scoundrel
action->Scoundrel.description: When Falrok successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against melee attacks he attempts against it until the end of his next turn. action->Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
action->Swift Leap.description: Falrok jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Forge-Spurned.name: Forge-Spurned
Forge-Spurned.publicNotes: Evil dwarves who die having failed to live up to the exacting standards of the duergar god Droskar are sometimes forced to return to the material world as undead abominations known as forge-spurned.

action->Enternal Damnation.name: Enternal Damnation
action->Enternal Damnation.description: As long as its soul chain remains intact, a forge-spurned can't be truly destroyed. It rises again fully healed at the next sundown, even if its physical body was destroyed.

action->Searing Heat.name: Searing Heat
action->Searing Heat.description: A creature that touches the forge-spurned (including @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grappling} it or hitting it with an unarmed attack) takes @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save).

action->Forge Breath.name: Forge Breath
action->Forge Breath.description:
The forge-spurned breathes a cloud of stinging soot, ash, and glowing embers. This can affect either a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] or a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] centered on the forge-spurned and persists for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Each creature that moves into or starts their turn in the area takes @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save. A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute.

Creatures within the cloud are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, though not from the forge-spurned.

The forge-spurned can't use Forge Breath again until it has used Inflate Bellows.

action->Inflate Bellows.name: Inflate Bellows
action->Inflate Bellows.description:
Requirements The forge-spurned has used Forge Breath.

Effect The forge-spurned re-inflates its flaccid lungs, enabling it to use Forge Breath again.

action->Soul Chain.name: Soul Chain
action->Soul Chain.description:
If a creature is slain by an attack from the soul chain and the forge-spurned is able to retain the creature's corpse, it can bind the creature's soul into the soul chain (as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul}) with a day of work at a forge and a @Check[type:crafting|dc:20|name:Soul Chain Bind] check.

An individual whose soul is bound in this way can't be resurrected unless the soul chain is destroyed (Hardness 10, 40 HP, BT 20).

equipment->Shoddy Blunderbuss.name: Shoddy Blunderbuss
equipment->Shoddy Blunderbuss.description:
Activate 2

The blunderbuss fires an explosive shot that deals @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning],2d10[fire]]{4d6 bludgeoning damage plus 2d10 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true|name:Shoddy Blunderbuss Reflex Save|showDC:owner] save).

When firing the blunderbuss, you must critically succeed at a @Check[type:crafting|dc:20|name:Shoddy Blunderbuss Crafting] or @Check[type:engineering|dc:20|name:Shoddy Blunderbuss Engineering Lore|showDC:owner]{Engineering Lore} check or the weapon explodes, damaging you for the same amount as the creatures in the cone and destroying itself. A successful @Check[type:crafting|dc:22|name:Shoddy Blunderbuss Reveal Unstable Nature|showDC:owner] check is enough to confirm the weapon's unstable nature if someone examines it beforehand.

Reloading the blunderbuss takes 3 Interact actions: adding 1 dose of gunpowder, adding 1 grapeshot canister, and packing the contents.

A black powder keg explodes if it takes any fire damage, inflicting @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage on all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true|name:Gunpowder Detonation] save).

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ylUdMTsfOQGJ3MN3]

Activate A Interact

An alchemical substance applied to one end of this tiny wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with flint and steel. You can ignite the tindertwig and touch it to a flammable object as part of the same Interact action.

backpack->Bag of Holding (Type I).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.jaEEvuQ32GjAa8jy]
Bag of Holding (Type I)
backpack->Bag of Holding (Type I).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.jaEEvuQ32GjAa8jy]

Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The amount of Bulk the bag's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type.

You can Interact with the bag of holding to put items in or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

Capacity 25 Bulk

action->Whiplash.name: Whiplash
action->Whiplash.description:
Trigger A creature within 10 feet of Gerhard uses an action with the move trait to leave a square.

Effect Gerhard attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the triggering creature. On a success, the creature also takes damage as if Gerhard hit with his whip Strike, and if the creature was flying, it falls 30 feet.

action->Manly Left Hook.name: Manly Left Hook
action->Manly Left Hook.description: A creature struck by Gerhard's punch must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure).

action->Shoddy Blunderbuss.name: Shoddy Blunderbuss
action->Shoddy Blunderbuss.description:
Gerhard fires an explosive shot from his blunderbuss that deals @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning],2d10[fire]]{4d6 bludgeoning damage plus 2d10 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true]).

When firing the blunderbuss, Gerhard must succeed at a @Check[type:crafting|dc:20] or @Check[type:engineering-lore|dc:20]{Engineering Lore} check or the weapon explodes, damaging him for the same amount as the creatures in the cone and destroying itself. If someone other than Gerhard uses the weapon, they must critically succeed at the check. A successful @Check[type:crafting|dc:22] check is enough to confirm the weapon's unstable nature if someone examines it beforehand.

Reloading the blunderbuss takes 3 Interact actions: adding 1 dose of gunpowder, adding 1 grapeshot canister, and packing the contents.

Effect Gerhard uses his whip to lash upward to wrap around an overhanging tree branch; he then swings up to 30 feet in a straight line, and must end the movement on solid ground or fall.

Gloomglow Mushrooms.name: Gloomglow Mushrooms
Gloomglow Mushrooms.description: A field of grass-like fungal filaments amid clusters of softly glowing, long-stalked mushrooms.
Gloomglow Mushrooms.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:22|name:Clear Patch of Mushrooms|traits:environmental,fungus,hazard] (expert) to remove a 5-foot-patch without triggering the mushrooms.

action->Glowing Spores.name: Glowing Spores
action->Glowing Spores.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the mushrooms' space or damages the mushrooms. The mushrooms can't use this reaction if the damage was cold damage.

Effect The triggering creature and all creatures within 10 feet are sprayed with itchy, distracting, glowing spores and must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:22|traits:environmental,fungus,hazard] save. On a failed save, the creatures become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) and take a -4 penalty to Stealth checks until the spores lose potency in 24 hours or are removed. This requires washing them off by bathing in water for a minute, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Qw3fnUlaUbnn7ipC]{Prestidigitation} spell, or a similar measure allowed by the GM.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.eZL4B1P4H8hr1CAn]{Effect: Glowing Spores}

Grauladon.name: Grauladon
Grauladon.publicNotes:
Grauladons are vicious predators that appear crocodilian in form, but are in fact distant offshoots of dragonkind. They make their dens in the shallows of fetid ponds or isolated corners of larger bodies of water, usually in rural swamps or woodlands. Driven almost entirely by their base desire to feed, grauladons spend most of their time swimming leisurely underwater looking for prey such as fish or waterfowl. Possessed of a greed befitting their more majestic dragon cousins, grauladons often take down prey larger than they need, jealously guarding the corpses to keep scavengers away even as the meat rots. A typical grauladon is 16 feet long from its snout to the tip of its tail and weighs 1,500 pounds.

A grauladon's stench may seem supernaturally disgusting, but it is simply the result of the creature's fetid habitat and diet of rotting, waterlogged meat. As grauladons' exhalations bear a passing resemblance to dragons' breath, they have earned the nickname "mud drakes" from rural folk.

Grauladons can be found in both fresh and brackish water in most temperate climates. They prefer to lair in shallow waters, particularly where reeds or other foliage conceal their bulk from unsuspecting prey. Grauladons are highly territorial and won't tolerate other predators living or hunting near their homes.

action->Reactive Breath.name: Reactive Breath
action->Reactive Breath.description:
Trigger The grauladon takes damage from an adjacent creature.

Effect The grauladon uses Noxious Breath, including the triggering creature in the area.

action->Body Slam.name: Body Slam
action->Body Slam.description:
Requirements More than one enemy is adjacent to the grauladon.

Effect The grauladon swings its tail at each adjacent enemy and attempts to Trip each creature adjacent to it. It rolls only a single Athletics check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of each target.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: A grauladon can hold its breath for 225 rounds (22-1/2 minutes).

action->Noxious Breath.name: Noxious Breath
action->Noxious Breath.description:
The grauladon hisses and unleashes a nauseating cloud of halitosis in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18] saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

The grauladon can't use Noxious Breath or Reactive Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Noxious Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Graveshell.name: Graveshell
Graveshell.publicNotes:
The graveshell is a dangerous predator that draws scavengers and explorers into its grasp using a morbid lure: the corpse of a former victim impaled upon the spikes that protrude from its large, turtle-like shell. Aside from its shell, the monster resembles no known animal. Small but bright yellow eyes watch from the sagging flesh of its head, the most prominent feature of which is a curiously shaped, toothy maw twisted into a perpetual grin. Its stubby arms and legs are impractical for both walking and swimming, though the algae-caked claws tipping each limb are deadly weapons.

Graveshells are intelligent-a fact that surprises many who encounter them-and surrender rather than fight to the death. These monsters have little to offer in exchange for their lives, though the waterlogged treasures on their collection of corpses may entice opportunists.

shield->Shell.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ezVp13Uw8cWW08Da]
Shell
shield->Shell.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ezVp13Uw8cWW08Da]

A graveshell's shell has a Hardness of 6, 10 Hit Points, and a Broken Threshold of 5. If its shell is broken, the graveshell can't attack with shell spikes, nor can it use Shell Game. If the shell is destroyed, the graveshell's AC is reduced to 16. As long as a graveshell is alive, its shell naturally repairs itself after a week.

action->Corpse Disguise.name: Corpse Disguise
action->Corpse Disguise.description: The graveshell conceals its true nature over the course of a few minutes by impaling a corpse (typically humanoid) on its spiky shell before partially submerging itself in water. It has an automatic result of 22 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a corpse floating in the water.

action->Wavesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.VdSMQ6yRZ3YXNXHL]
Wavesense (Imprecise) 30 feet

action->Shell Block.name: Shell Block
action->Shell Block.description:
Trigger The graveshell takes damage from a physical attack while withdrawn into its shell

Effect The graveshell reduces the damage from the attack by an amount equal to its shell's Hardness. A graveshell's shell has a Hardness of 6, 10 Hit Points, and a Broken Threshold of 5. If its shell is broken, the graveshell can't attack with shell spikes, nor can it use Shell Game. If the shell is destroyed, the graveshell's AC is reduced to 16. As long as a graveshell is alive, its shell naturally repairs itself after a week.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: The graveshell can hold its breath for 200 rounds (20 minutes).

action->Shell Game.name: Shell Game
action->Shell Game.description: The graveshell withdraws into its shell, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and allowing it to use Shell Block. This lasts until the graveshell moves or attacks with any attack other than its shell spikes. The graveshell can't take this action or get any benefit from it if its shell is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}.

Grippli Archer.name: Grippli Archer
Grippli Archer.publicNotes:
Frog-like humanoids who make their homes in the treetops of tropical jungles and forests, gripplis are uniquely adapted to their environment. Their oversized eyes give them keen vision in both light and dark, and their large toes allow them to easily scale the trees atop which they reside. Gripplis vary widely in physical appearance, their physiologies largely determined by their surrounding environment; those who live in verdant forests, for example, typically have bright green skin and red eyes. In contrast, gripplis who live in regions of rot and decay have mottled brown coloration, and those who dwell near lakes or streams may bear bright blue and orange stripes. Typical gripplis are just over 2 feet tall and weigh approximately 30 pounds.

Whatever region they come from, gripplis tend to be peaceful hunter-gatherers. Due to their modest understanding of agriculture, gripplis don't raise crops in the traditional sense, although they do cultivate mushroom patches and gather a wide array of fruits from the surrounding wilderness. The jungle also contains rivers and lakes filled with silver-scaled fish, which gripplis harvest in a sustainable manner to ensure their future supply, as well as fatty insects that grow much larger than in other parts of the world. Some of the most advanced grippli societies capture and breed these insects, nurturing herds of giant dragonflies or beetles that are eventually slaughtered for food for the rest of the village. Particularly enterprising gripplis even seek out and tame huge flying insects to use as mounts during their hunts. The rearing of such massive insects is no easy feat, however, so gripplis who manage to do so are often heralded as local heroes.

The treetop settlements of the grippli are difficult to spot from the forest floor. Gripplis obscure their holdings with broad leaves and thick branches, and they riddle the surrounding forest with labyrinthine trails that only they know how to navigate. Their villages are usually constructed among the densest populations of trees, with thin rope bridges strung between wide wooden platforms built around each trunk.

These sharpshooters are renowned for their patience and their accuracy.

action->Hail of Arrows.name: Hail of Arrows
action->Hail of Arrows.description: The grippli archer makes three ranged Strikes with their shortbow, all against a single target. Combine the damage of any Strikes that hit for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

action->Jungle Stride.name: Jungle Stride
action->Jungle Stride.description: A grippli ignores difficult terrain in forests and jungles.

Hellcrown.name: Hellcrown
Hellcrown.publicNotes:
The life of a Hellknight is bloody, brutal, and often short. Many who perish in service to a Hellknight order are glad to rest after having served their masters so faithfully, but others seek to continue their work even in death. When a Hellknight is decapitated, the ghostly undead known as a hellcrown is an occasional result. Consumed by the desire to bring about order by inflicting cruelty, hellcrowns haunt battlefields and abandoned castles, slaying all they encounter. A strange fusion of spirit and steel, a hellcrown has no corporeal form by itself, but instead inhabits the helmet it so proudly wore in life. Dangling from the helmet like a shroud is a shadow of the former Hellknight's spine, adding to the creature's terrifyingly gruesome appearance. Hellknights regard hellcrowns with a mixture of disgust and respect, considering the individuals who transform into these floating undead to have been resolute in purpose but weak in body.

A hellcrown usually manifests hours or longer after its body's death, and only when its body is unattended; this might even take days if the Hellknight perished in a major battle. Typically, no recognizable fragment of the Hellknight's former personality survives the grisly transformation into a hellcrown, but in rare and particularly tragic cases a hellcrown might remember its life and hold grudges against those it views as the cause of its death. Regardless of whether they retain memories of their lives or have lost all former sense of self, hellcrowns linger around the site of their death, reminding all they encounter of the merciless principles of their order.

action->Bleeding Nail.name: Bleeding Nail
action->Bleeding Nail.description: If the hellcrown hits with a nail Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16] save. On a failure, the nail is embedded in the creature, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and giving it @Damage[1[bleed]] damage (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @Damage[1d4[bleed]] on a critical failure). Each additional embedded nail increases the enfeebled value by 1 (to a maximum of enfeebled 4) and the bleed damage by 1. A creature can remove a nail with an Interact action to reduce the enfeeblement and amount of bleed damage. Pulling out the last nail removes both conditions.

action->Terrifying Stare.name: Terrifying Stare
action->Terrifying Stare.description: All creatures that can see the hellcrown and are suffering from its bleeding nail must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:16] saving throw. A creature that fails is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and on a critical failure becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as it's frightened. Any creature that attempts a save is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

All creatures other than Hezle in the smoke cloud must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save.

action->Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements Ilssrah has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature.

Effect Ilssrah attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If she succeeds at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+30 #attack]]{+30} modifier against the target's AC, she applies the manacles.

action->Hammer the Chained.name: Hammer the Chained
action->Hammer the Chained.description:
Ilssrah attempts a melee Strike with Fleshroaster. If she hits, she also draws her light hammer, makes a melee Strike with it against the same target, and immediately returns it to her belt. She then resumes her grip on Fleshroaster. Both Strikes count toward Ilssrah's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until both Strikes have been made. If the hammer Strike hits, it deals damage as normal and the target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is clumsy 1 and stupefied 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Immortal Ichor.name: Immortal Ichor
Immortal Ichor.publicNotes: An immortal ichor is an intelligent mass of blood from a dead evil deity. The cultists who perform the ritual to create immortal ichor typically seal up the sentient ooze in an underground or remote chamber that blocks its magical abilities, but over time these seals break or weaken, freeing the unholy monster.

action->Immortality.name: Immortality
action->Immortality.description: The immortal ichor doesn't age, nor does it need to eat or breathe. It can die only as a result of violence.

action->Corrupt Ally.name: Corrupt Ally
action->Corrupt Ally.description: A creature that fails to save against an immortal ichor's charm spell becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}. The stupefied value reduces by 1 every 24 hours. The first time each day a creature stupefied by the ichor's charm fails to save against another casting of the ichor's charm, the value of the condition increases by [[/r 1d4]]. If the stupefied condition ever equals the creature's Wisdom score, it becomes controlled by the ichor permanently; if it dies, it rises the next round as a zombie (of the GM's choice) under the ichor's control. If the ichor is killed, these zombies are destroyed.

action->Dead Spells.name: Dead Spells
action->Dead Spells.description: An immortal ichor can cast an initial and advanced domain spell of a domain that belonged to the dead deity from which the ichor arose (the domain spells presented here are from the destruction domain).

action->Mental Erosion.name: Mental Erosion
action->Mental Erosion.description: A creature hit by the ichor's pseudopod is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 day unless it succeeds at a @Check[type:will|dc:35] save.

action->Resanguinate.name: Resanguinate
action->Resanguinate.description: The immortal ichor draws blood from the pores of living creatures around it. Any living creature within 30 feet that has blood takes [[/r {4d6}]]{4d6 damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|basic:true] save). The immortal ichor regains HP equal to the total damage dealt. A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure).

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qCEOZ6109Yo34tRx]

Contains formulas for all common alchemical items of 19th level or lower.

A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.

action->Inject Unstable Mutagen.name: Inject Unstable Mutagen
action->Inject Unstable Mutagen.description:
Trigger Ingnovim damages a creature with a syringe Strike

Effect The creature injected with unstable mutagen must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save to resist the injection.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Failure The target's body shifts and mutates, growing difficult to control; the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 24 hours.

Critical Failure The target's body completely distorts into a shuddering blob of warped flesh that is incapable of action; the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. Every 24 hours, the target may attempt a new saving throw against this effect; on a critical success, the paralysis ends.

action->Mutagenic Adaptation.name: Mutagenic Adaptation
action->Mutagenic Adaptation.description: Ingnovim's body has adapted to the constant use of his mutagens. He does not suffer the drawback of any bestial mutagens but is still affected normally by other mutagens.

action->Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
action->Quick Bomber.description: Ingnovim draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

weapon->Longsword.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]

Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

action->Fast Healing 20.name:

action->Death Throes.name: Death Throes
action->Death Throes.description:
When one of Ingnovim's assistants dies, it bursts open in a foul-sounding and smelling explosion of toxic viscera and poisonous vapors. All creatures within a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38] save to resist this blast of poison.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[7d8[poison]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[14d8[poison],2d8[persistent,poison]]{14d8 poison damage and 2d8 persistent poison damage}.

consumable->Potion of Flying (Greater).description:

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Zdh2uO1vVYJmaqld]{Effect: Potion of Flying (Greater)}

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]

Inizra can use Attack of Opportunity when a creature within her reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. She can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and she disrupts actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Boundless Reprisals.name: Boundless Reprisals
action->Boundless Reprisals.description: Inizra gains a reaction at the start of each enemy's turn that she can use only during that turn.

action->Mirror Shield.name: Mirror Shield
action->Mirror Shield.description:
Requirements You have a shield raised.

Trigger An opponent casting a spell that targets you critically fails a spell attack roll against your AC.

Effect You reflect the spell back against the triggering opponent. Make a ranged attack against the triggering creature using your highest proficiency with a ranged weapon. If you can cast spells, you can make a spell attack roll instead. If you succeed, your opponent takes the effects of a successful spell attack roll for their own spell (or the effects of a critical success if your attack roll was a critical success).

action->Paragon's Guard Stance.name: Paragon's Guard Stance
action->Paragon's Guard Stance.description: Inizra always has her shield raised as if she had used the Raise a Shield action, as long as she meets that action's requirements.

action->Weapon Supremacy.name: Weapon Supremacy
action->Weapon Supremacy.description: Inizra is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1}. She can use her extra action only to Strike.

consumable->Nightmare Salt.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dRi775Uhzqgn7aBs]

This potent poison consists of crystals whose flavor and appearance mimics edible salt but whose effects are deadly: victims experience periods of waking nightmares that overload the senses and eventually result in death through a combination of shock and exhaustion.

Activate 3 Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43]

Onset 1 hour

Maximum Duration 5 days

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} once every [[/r 1d4]] hours, plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute once every [[/r 1d4]] hours, plus frightened 3 and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 3 frightened 3, plus confused for [[/r 1d4]] minutes, once every hour, plus fatigued (1 day)

Stage 4 death

consumable->Oblivion Essence.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5hGJ6CZi0A9OjMd4]

Created from a daemon's powdered soul gems or refined from the waters of Abaddon's rivers, oblivion essence causes victims to rapidly age and decay.

Activate A Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, and slowed 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[12d6[poison]] damage, enfeebled 3, slowed 1 (1 round)

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

Ishti can take on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage modifiers with her Strikes, but it does prevent them from using her cursed touch. Ishti has a fixed humanoid form-they cannot adopt a different appearance each time they use this ability, and the appearance resembles that of their upper torso when in their true form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Matriarch's Caress.name: Matriarch's Caress
action->Matriarch's Caress.description:
Ishti touches a creature, who must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} if it critically fails).

If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (or 2 if it critically fails) (to a maximum of stupefied 4). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.

action->Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
action->Poison Weapon.description: Ishti applies a poison to a piercing or slashing weapon of her choice.

action->Quick Dervish Strike.name: Quick Dervish Strike
action->Quick Dervish Strike.description: Ishti makes a dagger attack against each enemy within reach. Each attack counts toward her multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after all the attacks. The first enemy she damages is subject to matriarch's caress.

  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.k34hDOfIIMAxNL4a]{Grim Tendrils}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]{Enfeeble}

  • 4th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.k34hDOfIIMAxNL4a]{Grim Tendrils}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.N1Z1oLPdBxaSgrEE]{Vampiric Feast}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.a7A4xY3NeWI2Ya4Z]

When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

action->Bones of Stone.name: Bones of Stone
action->Bones of Stone.description:
Requirements The target is standing on or adjacent to a stone surface.

Frequency once per round

Effect Jaggaki calls upon unquiet spirits within the land, causing a giant skeletal arm made of jagged stone to reach out of a stone surface adjacent to a creature within 60 feet. Jaggaki makes a hand Strike against the target via this stone arm rather than using his own hand. If the Strike hits, it deals @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

action->Drain Soul Cage.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.fqZhojt2M5LfSKSH]

action->Drain Soul Cage.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.fqZhojt2M5LfSKSH]

Frequency once per day

Effect Jaggaki taps into his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage's} power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest level he can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells.

Jaggaki's soul cage doesn't need to be present for him to use this ability.

action->Paralyzing Touch.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.XvPm866TKSfclErJ]

action->Paralyzing Touch.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.XvPm866TKSfclErJ]

A creature damaged by the Jaggaki's hand Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save.

The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and seems dead. A @Check[type:medicine|dc:25|name:Diagnose Paralysis] check reveals the victim is alive.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt Jaggaki's spellcasting action, Jaggaki attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] check. If he succeeds, his action isn't disrupted.

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
spell->Dancing Lights.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

Trigger An enemy damages one of Jahsi's allies within 15 feet of him.

Effect The foe must choose one: The ally is unharmed by the triggering damage, or the ally gains resistance 10 against the triggering damage, and the enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of its next turn.

Kalavakus.name: Kalavakus
Kalavakus.publicNotes: Kalavakuses work as slavers in the Abyss, earning them the alternate moniker of "slaver demons"; these fiends round up captured victims and sell them to other fiends or unscrupulous mortals. Pleas for freedom or clemency fall on deaf ears, as slaver demons consider anyone they can catch and hold to be their rightful property and theirs to sell. Kalavakuses know more than just physical means of restraining slaves; they also know how to fetter a victim's soul. The most successful slaver demons have vast slave-pits in the Abyss where they keep stables of imprisoned souls.
Kalavakus.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Horn Snare.name: Horn Snare
action->Horn Snare.description:
Trigger A creature misses the slaver demon with a melee weapon Strike.

Effect The slaver demon attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the weapon used in the triggering Strike with a -2 penalty. If it rolls a success, it gets a critical success instead. The demon doesn't need a free hand to use this ability.

action->Liberation Vulnerability.name: Liberation Vulnerability
action->Liberation Vulnerability.description: The first time each round that a creature escapes from the slaver demon's Enslave Soul or the slaver demon witnesses a creature being freed from captivity or mental enslavement, the demon takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

action->Enslave Soul.name: Enslave Soul
action->Enslave Soul.description:
The demon enslaves the soul of a living creature within 60 feet. The target can attempt to resist this enslavement with a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save.

A slaver demon can have only one living soul enslaved with this ability at a time, and no more than one slaver demon can enslave the same soul. If a slaver demon kills a creature whose soul it has enslaved, the demon regains [[/r 20[healing]]]{20 HP} and the soul is consigned to an eternity of toil in the Abyss, adding to the slaver demon's tally of souls and allowing the demon to enslave another.

Success The target avoids being enslaved and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Failure The target is enslaved and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 24 hours or until the slaver demon is slain, whichever comes first.

Critical Failure As failure, and the target also suffers the effects of a failed saving throw against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate}.

equipment->Sterling Blacksmith's Tools.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.0QgniSjpzksm5riV]

equipment->Sterling Blacksmith's Tools.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.0QgniSjpzksm5riV]

You need these tools to create items from raw materials with the Craft skill. Sterling artisan's tools give you a +1 item bonus to the check.

Different sets are needed for different work, as determined by the GM; for example, blacksmith's tools differ from woodworker's tools.

action->Master Smith.name: Master Smith
action->Master Smith.description: As the most skillful blacksmith in Kovlar, Kelda's abilities far surpass those of typical smiths. She can Craft items as if she were 16th level. Additionally, she knows how to make a vast catalog of items, including numerous uncommon formulas and several rare formulas. The exact formulas she knows can be tailored to fit the needs of each particular group of PCs, but most are for weapons, armor, and other items that could reasonably be made in a forge.

King Harral.name: King Harral

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.CeSh8QcVnqP5OlLj]{Pinpoint}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->Archery Experience.name: Archery Experience
action->Archery Experience.description: Laslunn doesn't take the penalty from the volley trait, and her ranged Strikes don't trigger reactions.

action->Bark Orders.name: Bark Orders
action->Bark Orders.description: Laslunn issues a command to reposition her allies. Allies who hear and understand this order can use a reaction to Step.

action->Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
action->Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements Laslunn has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature.

Effect Laslunn attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If she succeeds at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+28 #Manacles]]{+28} modifier against the target's AC, she applies the manacles to the creature's wrists or legs.

action->Rugged Travel.name: Rugged Travel
action->Rugged Travel.description: Laslunn ignores the first square of difficult terrain she moves into each time she Steps or Strides.

action->Superior Pack Attack.name: Superior Pack Attack
action->Superior Pack Attack.description: Laslunn deals an extra 2d8 damage to any creature that's within reach of at least one of her allies.

action->Twin Shot.name: Twin Shot
action->Twin Shot.description: Laslunn makes two Strikes with her bow using her current multiple attack penalty. If both attacks hit the same creature, combine the damage and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating Laslunn's multiple attack penalty.

action->Golem Antimagic.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.r34QDwKiWZoVymJa]

harmed by cold and vitality ([[/r 5d10]], [[/r 2d8]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by void (area [[/r 2d8[healing]]] Hit Points); slowed by earth

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

  • Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.
  • Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.
  • Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/r 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round.
  • Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

action->Necrotic Field.name: Necrotic Field
action->Necrotic Field.description:
30 feet. Vitality energy effects within the golem's necrotic field deal only half their normal damage. Additionally, all undead within its aura deal an additional @Damage[1d6[void]] damage with their natural attacks.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.kjP0J97hhoIhbF3M]{Effect: Necrotic Field}

action->Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh.name: Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh
action->Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh.description: A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Pr1ruNTbzGn3H9w5]{Stone to Flesh} spell negates the golem's antimagic and its resistance to physical damage for 1 round. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} spell reverses this effect immediately.

action->Inexorable March.name: Inexorable March
action->Inexorable March.description: The golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it takes damage equal to that dealt by the golem's fist Strike

action->Necrotic Affliction.name: Necrotic Affliction
action->Necrotic Affliction.description:
Trigger The golem hits a slowed creature.

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure) as the golem's lazurite leeches vital energies and causes wounds to rot.

action->Necrotic Pulse.name: Necrotic Pulse
action->Necrotic Pulse.description: Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save or take @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage and be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute as their flesh and bones temporarily atrophy. The golem can't use Necrotic Pulse again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Necrotic Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

Lesser Dragonstorm.name: Lesser Dragonstorm
Lesser Dragonstorm.description: A small-scale version of a dragonstorm-a churning vortex of wind infused with fire, acid, lightning, poison, and ice-fills Alseta's Ring.
Lesser Dragonstorm.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:40|name:Call for Divine Intervention] (legendary) to call out to a non-evil deity for direct intervention to disperse the lesser dragonstorm (prayers to Apsu allow characters who are masters in Religion to attempt the check as if they were legendary instead), @Check[type:thievery|dc:42|name:Deactivate Vengegate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to deactivate Vengegate while the manifestation is forcing it open, or a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level; DC 40) to counteract the lesser dragonstorm.
Lesser Dragonstorm.routine: (1 action) On its initiative, the lesser dragonstorm reaches out and blasts all creatures within Alseta's Ring. Affected creatures take @Damage[2d8[acid],2d8[cold],2d8[electricity],2d8[fire],2d8[poison]]{10d8 damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:46|basic:true]), evenly split between acid, cold, fire, electricity, and poison. Creatures that fail their save are pulled 20 feet toward the center of Alseta's Ring (or are knocked prone and pulled 30 feet on a critical failure). After 10 rounds, the lesser dragonstorm is destroyed, but a much greater dragonstorm manifests in the surrounding region-see The Dragonstorm.

action->Manifest Lesser Dragonstorm.name: Manifest Lesser Dragonstorm
action->Manifest Lesser Dragonstorm.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to activate Vengegate

Effect The chamber within Alseta's Ring fills with a dragonstorm. Creatures within this area take @Damage[2d8[acid],2d8[cold],2d8[electricity],2d8[fire],2d8[poison]]{10d8 damage}, equally split between acid, cold, electricity, fire, and poison.
